reviews.title: Great services, except...
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, clean, upscale, and services couldn't be better. Front desk personnel tripped over themselves trying to accommodate our every desire. Breakfast was adequate. Unfortunately, I'll never go back to this hotel. BEWARE. I'd booked a block of rooms for my daughter's wedding three months prior to our stay and explained at the time of the booking that my daughter and her bridesmaids would need Friday night reservations for two rooms and would need them until 2:30 pm Saturday afternoon for the 4pm wedding--i.e., a late checkout. The week before the wedding, I was verifying our personal bookings and the late checkout for the two rooms my daughter and her bridesmaids needed, and was told the late checkout was impossible unless I wanted to pay an extra $75 per room. Although we secured AT LEAST 22 bookings (over $3,000) for the hotel, that made no difference whatsoever. All the surrounding hotels were booked at that point, so we couldn't transfer bookings. I left two personal voice mail messages during the week for Darcy, the General Manager, who failed to return my calls. Finally, after I was checked in, she did take my phone call, at my insistence, and verified that she would not give my daughter and her bridesmaids a two and a half hour late checkout--she wasn't even willing to provide one room with late checkout. I begged her to simply schedule either of those two rooms last for cleaning, but she said she was in business to make money and she wouldn't let the girls stay in the rooms unless I forked over ANOTHER $150. They got all our bookings and left us high and dry. My daughter and her bridesmaids had to lug all their stuff to my room, check out of the hotel and then get dressed and do their makeup while I was trying to do the same in my own room. (They'd had hair appts. earlier in the day but had to check out upon their return to the Hotel.) The entire experience was incredibly stressful and could have easily been avoided. Darcy was unresponsive and borderline rude and despite our having steered probably $3500 her way, wouldn't meet my request that I'd expressed from the get-go. I'll NEVER go there again, nor would I ever recommend the Lancaster Arts Hotel to anyone, including you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful lobby, beautiful room, great breakfast, great personnel AND a rose on the pillow each night. And all for a great price! This beautiful hotel had it all . . . so close to "the country", but with an upscale city feel. Loved the "artsy" feel of this place . . a short story to read at breakfast, a sketchpad in the room, and all within walking distance to a great little artsy city. We will defintely stay here on our next trip to Lancaster.
reviews.title: Found a gem in Lancaster

reviews.text: We stayed here got the National Beard & Moustache Championships on 10/11. Rooms, staff, and food were all amazing!! Cabs were free anywhere in the city, amazing service!! Only place I would ever stay in Lancaster
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!

reviews.text: Great hotel, good location, stylish rooms, good value for the price. Cool staff at the front desk,..shout out to Bryan for all the info..free wifi..AND free cab service within a 5mile radius if the hotel...NICE...Definitey no less than 4.5 stars...the listed hotel class here is wrong!

better than "amish country" !
reviews.text: we loved the hotel, small, intimate and oh! so clean! have been to lancaster before-stayed at B& and spent all my time in the country. this was so nice! Loved treh galleries and small shops. we'll be back!

My daughter wanted us to stay at a hip place in the land of quaint bed and breakfasts. The Arts seemed like the place. I wish it had been. Our room was very small. The breakfast room was dark and very 1980's Hampton Inn like in both decor and food. The restaurant we had dinner in was average. The claim to fame is the art throughout the hotel. It was nice, but you can't sleep on it or eat it so it was just icing in search of a cake to put it on.
reviews.title: Icing in search of a cake

reviews.text: Not being part of a chain i did not know what to expect..I was pleasently surprised. The building is really beautiful, the rooms are spacious, and the restaurant was great.
reviews.title: a nice surprise

reviews.text: The Lancaster Arts Hotel is the place to stay when visiting Lancaster. The Lancaster Arts Hotel combines an upscale hotel experience with a great location. Usually, if I'm traveling alone, I will stay a one of the local national brands to collect reward points. On this most recent trip, I was hosting a group of visitors. The Lancaster Arts Hotel was the hotel of choice. It's unique design, rooms with interior brick walls, comfortable beds, etc...give it a classy feel. It's location is also a plus since it is within an easy walk of the many restaurants located near the F&M campus and downtown Lancaster. It's a 10 min walk to the Iron Hill Brewery across from F&M. Also, guests of the hotel have access to the YMCA located directly across the street. The Y has one of the best fitness rooms I have ever seen. I highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: The place to stay when visiting Lancaster

reviews.text: As a weekly business traveler, I typically stay at national brands and collect their reward points. I had occasion to host a NY customer in Lancaster and thought they would enjoy this hotel. They did and so did I.
reviews.title: Very pleased with my stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have dined at John Jeffries restaurant in the hotel many times and it is a must if you are staying at the Hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful and uniquely restored

reviews.text: I booked through a third party website and could not mention my preferred requirement of not going to the annex. Surely enough, I was assigned an annex room, clean and well appointed, but you are basically in an ordinary low ceiling room over the garage, ironically with great views of the historical building you wished (and booked for) you were staying at. Asked both nights to change room, but front desk, uninterested in taking any trouble, dismissed me quickly with the "we're fully booked" corollary, which the second night was not true.
reviews.title: Good, but avoid the annex.

reviews.text: It is a nice hotel with a good restaurant and close to downtown Lancaster, but honestly the room assignment made me feel penalised for finding a good rate online.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Lancaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Lancaster Arts Hotel over any of the chain hotels in the area and am very glad I did!
reviews.title: Consistently wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is very conveniently located near F& M campus and the central Lancaster business and arts district. The decor is unique and the staff is very friendly and attentive. The rates are slightly higher than some of the chain hotels, but the decor, staff and amenities are worth the difference. Especially unique was the cab service provided on a complimentary basis by the hotel to any restaurant or attraction within a 5 mile radius. It made my stay much more enjoyable and relaxing. I will definitely recommend it to friends and family and look forward to my next visit.
reviews.title: Marvelous and modern

reviews.text: My recent stay at LAH was probably my fifth, and each one had exceeded my already lofty expectations. Not only are the rooms very comfortable and clean, the bar and restaurant areas are also first-class.
reviews.title: "Another Great Stay"
Very attractive hotel in an "ok" area
reviews.text: This hotel is very attractive and historic from the inside out. The outside is all brick, and one of the walls in the rooms is, therefore, also brick. Everything is very chic. The rooms include a mini wine storage cooler. The decorations are very tastefully done. It looks like what I'd want my own bedroom to look like if I could redecorate. The bathrooms, too, are very modern and chic. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but it seemed to be very popular on a Friday night. The morning breakfast (included) was really good, in my opinion. They had breakfast burrito wraps, waffles, and hard-boiled eggs, for example. It was more than sufficent for us (two adults and a young child). The surrounding area near the hotel is not as attractive. I guess I expected the downtown area of Lancaster to be more attractive, based on web sites that I'd searched. We stayed here mainly because of its proximity to Dutch Wonderland. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting attractions in the Lancaster area. We had to leave a day early because of Hurricane Irene.

The Lancaster Arts Hotel, as other reviewers have noted, is a quirky hotel, with lots of original features. We particularly liked the bathroom, which was huge, and the toiletries supplied were just beautiful.
reviews.title: Individual and interesting hotel - very comfortable

reviews.text: The beds were comfortable and the bed linen was of a very high quality.
reviews.title: Better than expected, and I expected a lot...

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was a little odd, it is not in the centre of Lancaster and we found it difficult to find - although that could say more about our sense of direction. There is little within walking distance, but we did dine at the Thai restaurant in the small shopping centre in the shared car park and the food was lovely.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere, great service, and very accommodating for groups.

reviews.text: Breakfast at the hotel was very pleasant - my son particularly liked the breakfast burrito; and all the staff we met were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: It was such a treat...
